Description:
• Google Tensor G2 makes Pixel 7 faster, more efficient and more secure than previous Pixel phones.[1] And it delivers even more helpful features and the best photo and video quality yet on a Pixel.
  • It's easy to see what's on your Pixel screen. It adjusts to high brightness in sunshine, and automatically dims in the dark.
  • The Pixel 7 display is super sharp, with rich vivid colours. Andit's fast and response for smooth gaming, scrolling and moving between apps.[2]
  • [1]Compared to Pixel 6. Speed and efficiency claims based on internal testing on pre-production devices.
  • [2]Based on the use of Smooth Display (not available for all apps or content). Full-screen 160.5-mm (6.3-in)1 display
Pros:
• Good camera: Many reviewers praised the camera, with some saying it is the best on the market.

• Affordable price: The phone is offered at a competitive price, making it a good value for the money.

• Fast performance: The phone is fast and responsive, making it a good choice for gaming and other demanding tasks.

• Long battery life: The battery lasts for a long time, making it a good choice for people who are on the go.

• Sleek design: The phone has a sleek design that is both stylish and functional.
Cons:
• Screen defects: Some users reported screen defects, such as a blotch in the middle of the screen, burn-in, or a discolored area.

• Poor battery life: Some users reported that the battery life was not as good as they expected.

• Bluetooth issues: Some users reported that the phone had Bluetooth issues, such as not connecting to devices or dropping the connection.

• Microphone issues: Some users reported that the microphone did not work properly, making it difficult to make phone calls or use voice commands.

• Facial recognition issues: Some users reported that the facial recognition feature did not work properly, causing the phone to unlock when it should not have.

• Random shutdowns: Some users reported that the phone would randomly shut down, even when the battery was not low.

• Buggy fingerprint scanner: Some users reported that the fingerprint scanner was not very reliable, often failing to unlock the phone.
Pricing: The reviews for this product are generally positive, with many customers praising its camera quality, performance, and battery life. However, some customers have reported issues with the fingerprint sensor and the lack of a charger in the box.
Quality:
• Great camera: Many consumers praised the Pixel 7's camera, noting that it takes high-quality photos and videos.

• Fast performance: Other consumers noted that the Pixel 7 is fast and responsive, with no lag or slowdowns.

• Good battery life: Some consumers reported that the Pixel 7's battery lasts all day with moderate use.

• Affordable price: Many consumers were impressed with the Pixel 7's affordable price, which is comparable to other mid-range phones on the market.

• Lack of a charger: Some consumers were disappointed that the Pixel 7 does not come with a charger.

• Fingerprint sensor issues: A few consumers reported that the Pixel 7's fingerprint sensor is not very accurate, and sometimes fails to recognize fingerprints.
Performance:
• The Pixel 7 is a great value for the money, offering a top-tier camera, fast performance, and a clean Android experience.

• Some users have reported issues with the fingerprint sensor, which is not as reliable as on previous models.

• The battery life is average, and the phone does not come with a charger in the box.

• Overall, the Pixel 7 is a solid choice for anyone looking for a mid-range phone with a great camera and a clean Android experience.
Reliability: The reviews of the Pixel 7 are generally positive, with users praising the camera, performance, and clean Android experience. However, some users have reported issues with the fingerprint sensor, battery life, and lack of a charger in the box.
